column5: Happy Valentine's Day -- love you all! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

With AI surging, business leaders need to guide organizations through rapidly emerging opportunities and threats. I‚Äôm delighted FourthBrain is offering a live workshop on this, that I'm looking forward to speaking at. 
https://t.co/h9Apx9m2sE
I wish schools could make homework so joyful that students want to do it themselves, rather than let ChatGPT have all the fun.

If you're starting a reading group on Large Language Models (LLMs), what is one research paper you will want added to the reading list? 

Researchers: Feel free to recommend your own paper too!
Which type of Generative AI do you think will have a bigger commercial impact: Generating images (e.g., diffusion algorithms, stable diffusion) or text (e.g., LLMs, ChatGPT)?

@luis_likes_math 3/This specialization was designed with numerous interactive visualizations to help you see how the math works. Math isn‚Äôt about memorizing formulas; it‚Äôs about sharpening your intuition. I hope you enjoy the specialization!

@luis_likes_math 2/I‚Äôve often said ‚Äúdon‚Äôt worry about it‚Äù when it comes to math, because math shouldn‚Äôt hold anyone back from making progress in ML. And, understanding some key topics in linear algebra, calculus, and prob & stats will help you better get learning algorithms to work.

1/Math for Machine Learning and Data Science is now available on Coursera! Taught by @luis_likes_math, this gives an intuitive understanding of the most important math concepts for AI.
https://t.co/WFi3KSuVk7
Do large language models like ChatGPT have a shot at disrupting search engines? I share my take here. (Short answer: Yes. But the details are complicated.) https://t.co/r4qpNOwWN2
2/2 I also wrote a summary in The Batch of the common themes in the hopes people shared. Check it out here. https://t.co/i0c6WtoXhS
1/2 Thanks everyone that replied to this. Lots of great ideas here! The diversity of our hopes for AI is a sign of how large our field is -- we collectively want AI to go lots of places.
@renate I'm thrilled to be working with you @renate!
7/Exciting times ahead, and thank you Yoshua Bengio, @AlonHalevy, @douwekiela, @_beenkim, and @Reza_Zadeh for writing for The Batch!

6/Reza Zadeh sees generative AI bringing progress to active learning, where a system picks its own examples to be labeled to improve the data. With generative AI, he sees a potential revolution in algorithms generating new data to request to be labeled.
https://t.co/qQvvl76fZc

5/Been Kim discusses AI explainability. AI has taken an engineering-centric approach, where researchers devise techniques via trial and error, and she urges developing fundamental scientific principles that make explanations more trustworthy and accurate. https://t.co/4x91WS03TG

4/Douwe Kiela points out key directions: Multimodality, grounding, and interaction so AI understands us better; alignment, attribution, and uncertainty to make models safer; data-centric AI to improve scaling; and better ways to evaluate AI models. 
https://t.co/rkha650LrN

3/Alon Halevy envisions AI capturing massive amounts of data from your daily life -- photos, browsing, purchases -- and fusing it into a personal timeline that helps you track and achieve your goals, while preserving privacy. 
https://t.co/7vv92YtlyU

2/Yoshua Bengio wants to develop new architectures that can discover and reason with high-level concepts, rather than just brute force the learning process by scaling up existing models‚Äô data and compute. https://t.co/NsEdODxXbY

1/Several leaders share their hopes for AI in 2023, including finding key missing pieces that will enable algorithms to reason, building a personal data timeline, improving AI processes, discovering new principles for explainability, and using generative AI for active learning.
What do you hope for in AI in 2023?
2022 has been a great year for AI progress. Excitingly, this has laid a foundation for even more progress in 2023. Happy New Year, friends! üéâ

Despite the cold weather, we‚Äôre in the middle of a red hot AI summer. 
 
Read my thoughts ‚Äî and a roundup of this year‚Äôs biggest AI news ‚Äî in The Batch! https://t.co/4AXRQsGP2I
@YangK_ai @LandingAI Great list!
6/More about this in The Batch. https://t.co/piPHIS8qiK
5/For the World Cup final, here‚Äôs wishing good luck to the Argentina team üá¶üá∑, The France team üá´üá∑, and the AI engineering team ü§ñ!
4/It is inspiring that AI is making its way to all corners of society, with many applications large and small.
3/Twelve cameras track the players, and embedded sensors track the ball. Accurate real-time localization of everyone/everything makes off-side calls more accurate.
2/Human referees have struggled to accurately call violations of the off-side rule -- a complex rule involving positions of multiple players and the ball. This is where computer vision steps in.
1/I find AI‚Äôs role in the FIFA World Cup has made the game more fun! ‚öΩÔ∏è

New ebook! How can you build a career in AI? 

This compiles my tips on how to:
‚àô Learn technical skills üéì 
‚àô Choose and build AI projects üßë‚Äçüíª
‚àô Find a job ü¶æ

Let me know your feedback! 
https://t.co/L7uEnLsFu9

New course announcement! Math for Machine Learning and Data Science. 

Designed to make learning AI's math easy: 
‚àô Linear algebra 
‚àô Probability & Stats
‚àô Calculus

Will help learners build better ML systems and pass job interviews!  
https://t.co/bM70tPieXO
4/More on this in The Batch.  https://t.co/xCeSX8HbzT
3/Building large language models that can accurately decide when to be confident and when not to will reduce their risk of misinformation and build trust.
2/In contrast, real experts know when to sound confident, and when to let others know they‚Äôre at the boundaries of their knowledge. Experts know, and can describe, the boundaries of what they know.

1/Large language models like Galactica and ChatGPT can spout nonsense in a confident, authoritative tone. This overconfidence - which reflects the data they‚Äôre trained on - makes them more likely to mislead.
I feel lucky to be alive when technological marvels are invented every week. The rapid progress makes life more fun!
ChatGPT is sometimes amazing, and sometimes hilariously wrong. Here, it confidently explains to me why an abacus is faster than a GPU. üòÉ https://t.co/vpJZTStDnD

Congratulations Mark Chrystal and the @NetailAI team on closing $5M in funding to build AI to help retailers with pricing analytics. This is an exciting application of machine learning and will help many businesses.  @AI_Fund @magaracvc    https://t.co/sm9vkaGYtm

AI twitter had erupted in controversy over Meta‚Äôs release of the Galactica demo. Is it a dangerous product, or was it unnecessarily maligned with overblown fears of harm? Here‚Äôs my take. https://t.co/XlCIo3S0mf

A new UN Climate Change report estimates we might be on track to 2.5¬∞C of warming. It's time to seriously consider cooling down Earth by geoengineering using stratospheric aerosol injection, a solution in which AI will play a critical role. See why. https://t.co/UTa3XtY91I
Halloween is coming! üéÉ Check out our special issue of The Batch on this year's biggest AI fears. üëªhttps://t.co/8cyCWdbOua

I‚Äôd like to address the serious matter of some newcomers to AI experiencing imposter syndrome, where someone wonders if they‚Äôre a fraud or really belong in the AI community. Lets build a community that encourages and welcomes everyone. https://t.co/mWi5hy4D3p

The open way that Stable Diffusion's image generation model was released -- allowing users to it on their own machines, not just via API -- has made it a landmark event for AI. Kudos to @EMostaque and the @StableDiffusion team! More in The Batch. https://t.co/I6EWYjTfIf
Today is Labor Day in the U.S. I wish for all workers everywhere that we will all find work that is meaningful and joyful.

@therealsreehari AI product management is very exciting, with great opportunities for anyone who does it well. A software product manager specifies what the Code does. But AI systems are made up of Code + Data, and you can't fully control the Data. This makes AI product management fun & hard.

Finding an AI job can be difficult. By paying close attention to certain details during your search, you can raise your odds of finding a role, team, and company that you truly love. Read more in #TheBatch. https://t.co/7awosA08Hc

Interested in an AI job, but unsure what different roles entail? Informal chats with working professionals can help you narrow your job search. Read my tips on informational interviews (which are different from job interviews) in The Batch.  https://t.co/nl324moHnd

2/2 Good education really changes lives, but we also can‚Äôt continue to have students take out loans to pay for programs that don‚Äôt deliver hoped-for benefits. The current system isn‚Äôt sustainable, and we can and must do better.

1/2 Biden's $10,000 student debt forgiveness announcement is a reminder we need to make the education system better. Education needs to become more affordable, more inclusive, and less exclusionary. We also need to pay more attention to helping students find good jobs.

Here's a framework useful for searching for an AI job. Especially for people entering the field, consider if you‚Äôre switching roles and/or industries. Please take a look, and if you have any other AI job search tips to share, please reply to this tweet! https://t.co/MfcDyycDK5

Happy 75th Independence Day to all my friends in India! üáÆüá≥Democracy is a powerful tool for improving people's lives. It is wonderful to see the many people in India and worldwide continuing to fight for this ideal.
@alliekmiller @shravangoli @coursera @StanfordOnline It was great fun doing the panel with you @alliekmiller and @shravangoli!

Reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms are quite finicky -- sensitive to picking hard-to-tune hyperparameters -- compared to supervised deep learning, which has become much more robust the past decade. Will RL progress similarly? My thoughts in The Batch: https://t.co/WVDFYjFXWT

Course 3 of the new Machine Learning Specialization is now available on @Coursera! We'd launched Courses 1&2 last month, and this final course teaches unsupervised learning, recommender systems, and reinforcement learning. Check it out here: https://t.co/qHZoEqmWm2

@laroyo @icmlconf @DataCentricAI Thanks @laroyo and team for having me speak at the ICML DataPerf workshop. A lot of people had contributed to the Data-Centric AI competition last year, and I was glad to be able to share the story behind the competition.

To advance a career in AI, how should one pick projects to work on? Your career will include a sequence of projects growing in scope and complexity. So it helps to pick what can be a stepping stone. My tips on this career progression process in The Batch. https://t.co/tdrEKnySoL

Interested in accelerating your AI career? Join @alliekmiller, @coursera‚Äôs Shravan Goli and me on 8/3 for an interactive discussion about skills that will help you succeed. Reserve your spot here: https://t.co/F4iAOSAQOQ
Here's the link: https://t.co/PfjTeAAmw8

How do you pick projects to advance in a technical career in AI? Your career will include many projects, hopefully growing in scope, complexity, and impact over time. Picking good projects will create stepping stones for you to move forward and up. Tips in this week's The Batch.
What are the most important topics to study for building a technical career in AI? I share my thoughts on this in The Batch. https://t.co/sEfLAssKMc

Thanks! Last week I wrote about key steps to building a technical career in AI. The full letter is here: https://t.co/J39cCFjc4m 

Will have more to say on this in this week's The Batch!
@realSharonZhou Congratulations @realSharonZhou!

@tiangolo Thank you @tiangolo!üòÄI've been a fan of your FastAPI work for years -- I frequently recommend it for quickly deploying trained ML models, and we also use it in @DeepLearningAI_ 's MLOps specialization. I'm really thrilled to hear you'd found the ML class helpful!

How will rising interest rates affect AI? Projects that deliver financial returns within a few years will look more attractive than long-term bets. AI teams should be ready for increased pressure to demonstrate near-term tangible value. More here: https://t.co/cRMM1MZI0F

Read about the surprising origins of many of Machine Learning‚Äôs foundational algorithms here. Many algorithms were invented long before digital computers. I also found the first application of logistic regression, K-means and other algorithms fascinating!
https://t.co/SsocpasrHU

The call to arm teachers following the Texas school shooting tragedy is an awful idea.

Teachers need to focus on helping students learn, not on preparing for a shootout. The U.S. needs better gun safety laws to protect children.
https://t.co/vRMSiR1u0t
Speaking as someone who has worked on anti-spam against determined adversaries, I found this a nice,  thoughtful thread on the reality of spam. Thank you @paraga.
A few people asked if Coursera and I share a birthday. Yes we do -- April 18th. üòÄ

Coursera had started with my machine learning class. I‚Äôm delighted to announce that I‚Äôll soon be teaching a new Machine Learning Specialization, created by @StanfordOnline & @DeepLearningAI_. Please help me spread the word! You can sign up here: https://t.co/8WJOnNGz7W https://t.co/9X9QXYXM7a
@sequoia .@roelofbotha is a brilliant investor and leader. Congratulations!

I stand with Ukraine üá∫üá¶ against Putin's unprovoked invasion.

I just tested positive for Covid. 

I am very grateful to the people that‚Äôve worked on vaccines worldwide. My symptoms are comparable to a mild flu, but if I hadn‚Äôt had a vaccine & booster, I‚Äôm sure it would have been much worse. Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Given the impact of Computer Science and AI on every person, it is important to introduce K-12 learners to these subjects. I‚Äôm thrilled my friend @Andy_Pasinetti  (one of the best education leaders I know) is launching @Kira_Learning to transform K-12 computer science!

Today is the one year anniversary of the insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. We cannot take democracy in any country for granted, but must instead keep cherishing and defending it.
I‚Äôm looking forward to 2022. Let‚Äôs all of us together make it a great year!

I wrote in The Batch about some myths on Data-centric AI. What did I miss---are there any other misconceptions you‚Äôve come across and should be addressed? If so please reply to this to let me know! https://t.co/sQXh4UcU3u

How would you define Data-centric AI development? It'd be useful for all of us collectively to write a sharable definition. Here's my attempt: Data-centric AI is the practice of systematically engineering the data used to build AI systems. What do you think/any suggestions?
@SnorkelAI @aarti_bagul @ajratner @chelseabfinn Great to see Snorkel organizing a Data-Centric AI event and contributing to the movement. Thank you for having me!
@iamtrask Thanks @iamtrask and everyone on this thread!

I would love your thoughts on this: Data-centric AI is still an emerging field, but what do you think are the key pillars of data-centric AI? E.g., if you were reading a textbook on this nascent field, what are some major topics you‚Äôd like the book to include?

I wrote a short piece for Time Magazine on Jensen Huang's inclusion in Time 100, on his visionary leadership of the GPU revolution leading to incredible impact. Congratulations Jensen, and thank you for your work!

With the fall of Afghanistan's government, women's rights took a big step backward today. This is a sobering reminder that the rise of human rights isn't inevitable, and we have to keep pushing to bolster them.

Mental health is one of the most important problems of our time, and it is exciting to see Woebot Health leading the way. Congratulations to the @HiWoebot team on this milestone!

Would love your feedback on this: AI Systems = Code (model/algorithm) + Data. Most academic benchmarks/competitions hold the Data fixed, and let teams work on the Code. Thinking of organizing something where we hold the Code fixed, and ask teams to work on the Data. (1/2)
